After pouring so much time into the game, I feel it's time to write my toughts about it!

So going down with the positive first: 
- Fun game to play together with your friends! You can play online together as 4 survivors, or go custom as 5 people where one can play the killer.
- Plenty of characters to choose between and customize with items and perks.
- The possibility to unlock the character specific perks to the others.
- Plenty of different maps to play on, some of them even has 2 versions where they change the main building and some of the locations.
- The generators changes their places on most maps, so it feels varied.
- Each killer is unique with their own abilities.
- Just like with the survivors, the killers also have their own unique perks and customizable items.
- No in-game chat, which makes it extra ''tricky'', but still fun. 
- Shrine of secrets in the shop. When you level you get free shards that you can use to buy a characters, or specific perks that reset every 7th day.

Down to the negative:
- When a survivor ragequit/dc, the remaining survivors don't get anything in compensation. Ex: I had two people ragequit, but it still leaves me and another survivor left to do 5 generators alone against a killer who can just abuse this easily. This just makes it extremely hard and one wished they could either do that some generators get completed for compensation, or the game even get ''canceled'' , and rewards the people who's still left in the game with some compensational blood points. They could perhaps have added a vote system you can activate after X amount of time or if people ''dc''.
- The report system needs to be stronger. It feels no matter if you report people, nothing gets done about it unless you email them about it directly. But even then, you don't know if they will bother with it or not.
- Some unfair hitboxes. Ex when you have fully vaulted over a window or a palett, the killer still (somehow) managed to hit you from the other side. That one many can find rather odd, and even buggy.
- Odd bugs and glitches sometimes emerges, which can be quite annoying. 
- Hackers. Some people (even if RARELY found), will be hacking. Ex floating in the air, running superfast etc. So that can ofc be rather tedious.
- Rift missions can be slight tough to complete, especially if you have things you must complete in a single trial where you might need to stun the killer or something. When completing the missions too, you don't get too much of progress either.
- Rank system can be slightly odd when pairing up. You can get a lv 1 killer against a team of 14-18 people, not so fair when people still try get hang of the game.

All in all, still an ok and fun game with friends c: 
Even with their flaws, I do hope they might do something about some off the mentioned things above that can be slight problematic.

Да блядь, я не могу, с каждой секундой все становится более уебанским, обновление системы рангов, казалось мне неплохой идеей, но не самой полезной. К сути-худшее обновление. Играя за маньяка пепельного ранга ( с 20 по 16 вроде) попадая в лобби, первое время я был рад любому стаку выживших главное хоть поиграть, но пару тройку каток спустя я стал замечать что меня ебут, каждую сраную катку, и тут я начал смотреть профили того против кого буду играть, и я ахуел, 5 из 6 лобби это люди с от 1000 до 2500 часов, не все, но в лобби где 1-2 консольщика, найдется 1-2 таких чела, иногда и все 4, после таких игр я у всех замечаю золотые и красные ранги (с 1 по 8 примерно). Перейдем за сторону выживших: ебаный рот этого казино блядь, вы кто такие чтоб это делать, стандартный стак из минимум одного консольщика( впринципе ок) я и еще 2 человека, я опять уже не пепел (20-17) а целая 4 бронза (16 ранг) но суть не в этом, после игры, обращая внимание на ранги моих коллег по выживанию( людей из лобби) я вижу серебряные и золотые ранги, но вот вопрос, пусть я может и играю как дебич, но люди добрались до ~10 и меньше рангов, так а какого хуя они как будто первый раз зашли, любая катка за выживших сулит очевидный проеб ибо, даже если ман не так силен, все идет по пизде когда сурвы либо не чинят гены, либо блядь падают на первых минутах. Блядь почините ебаную игру сука.

I've been playing Dead by Daylight for over 2 years now, pretty much since Ghost Face released into the game. Since then and at the time of this review, I have put in a respectable ~1200 hours, being by far my most played game on Steam. When I started, I only played survivor with a few friends of mine, just learning the game and playing for fun, nothing more. Well obviously, I started falling in love with this wonderful game very quickly! 

I started playing every day, I started watching Youtube videos of people with thousands of hours in the game so I could get better at looping, I learned more slightly advanced mechanics such as window teching (before it got patched) and flashlight saving timing, and I was having a fantastic time! I even started playing killer so that I could become a better survivor by knowing exactly how each different killer played and how I could counter them, and I put a LOT of time into all of this.  Everything interested me from the variety of killers to play against (especially the cool licensed killers!), the different maps you could play on, clutch moments with friends that helped us all escape, it all just made me happy. I remember the first time I got to rank 1 survivor, the first time I did what I thought was impossible in getting rank 1 killer, and I remember the struggles I faced when I had to play against a disgustingly powerful nurse and bully squads that made me want to instantly alt + f4 out of the game. Even through the difficult portions, I still wanted to keep queueing up and load into the next match because I just loved the game THAT much. 

Well, as of September 12th, 2021, I unfortunately cannot say the same anymore. Behaviour has had some... very questionable updates in the past that the community has disliked. When The Twins were introduced into the game, most survivors hated them. They had a play style that didn't seemingly fit Dead by Daylight all that much. Promoted camping, heavy slugging, ways to win the game as killer that were generally just unfun to play against as a survivor. The update that accompanied The Twins was probably the buggiest update the game had ever had, What makes it worse, it took Behaviour literal months to fix the issues that came with the patch. Needless to say, the community was pretty outraged. 

The next killer, The Trickster, was probably the worst killer in the game on release. They released him on the PTB (a beta for players to test new killers before they're released into the live game, also allowing for the dev team to take feedback and change the killer to be more balanced), he was extremely weak, and everyone expected him to be buffed on live release. He was not. Not only was he still extremely weak on release, it took almost 4 WHOLE MONTHS for them to release a balance patch for him, even after months of outcry from the community begging for him to be buffed before his actual release, as well as for the months until his buff went live. Essentially what I'm trying to say... Behaviour has a very hard time listening to the community. Hell, the community has been asking for keys to be nerfed for YEARS and they have still ignored them. While these are just a few examples, nothing matches the most recent negativity from the community as the most recent update.

September 8th, 2021. Behaviour announces they are indefinitely adding Skill Based Match Making into the game as the only way to queue up for a match. For years, this game has been considered to be a fairly casual, fun game to play with friends, but now the devs decide they want to make all matches based on SBMM. 90% of the community is outraged. They've done tests before this official release, and even during those tests the community was very vocal about not wanting SBMM to be in the game. Yet again, the company did not listen to the player base, the ones giving their time and money to keep the game afloat. I've played a solid number of games with my friends on the survivor side since SBMM was implemented, and none of those games have been enjoyable. The first night, we matched up against a "competitive/pro DbD player" TWO TIMES, playing a very sweaty Spirit with almost 6000 hours in the game. Needless to say, it was extremely unpleasant. After the first night, we even legitimately discussed what our new game to play as a group would be since we were simply not having any fun at all, and it was honestly a little heartbreaking. 

SBMM forces the player (killer or survivor) to use the best perks available in the game. In a game with currently 182 perks in it, only 9-10 of them are viable to play with on either side. If you want to play around and use more fun perks that aren't so meta, prepare to be curb stomped back to the lobby. On the killer side, it's even worse. If you want any success playing as killer against high MMR players, you really only have 3-4 options of killers to play as whose power is strong enough to handle a very coordinated survivor team. That means ~21 or the 25 killers in the game have powers/abilities that are simply to weak to keep up against survivors at high MMR. In reality, against the best of the best and the most optimal of survivors, no killer is truly strong enough to compete, and that's simply due to a balancing issue that Behaviour have ignored since the game released, as well as Behaviour ignoring the community and their pleas to make the game more balanced. Instead of changing the fundamentals of the killers, buffing them in ways that would make them viable with the 3-4 top tier killers, they decided to go with the easier route and just implement SBMM instead it seems. 

As of now, I cannot recommend this game to anyone. No game I load into is fun, I have to sweat every match with almost no hope of escaping as survivor or getting any kills as killer, and this is by far the worst update Dead by Daylight has ever pushed out, not only because it was poorly thought out and the system was seemingly changed for no reason, but also because this update was a complete slap in the face towards the majority of the community, the supporters who want to see this game shine and live on for year, who vocalized their displeasure towards SBMM. We were completely ignored and tossed aside as if we meant nothing to the devs whatsoever. 

TL;DR: Due to SBMM and the current state of the game, it is completely not worth buying. Any longevity the game had has been tarnished and I could see the game completely dying in under a year unless Behaviour changes something.
